info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 20 at 1:55AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Areas of Fog, Locally Dense, Developing Across East Central Florida... At 154 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras showed areas of fog developing across east central Florida, especially from around Interstate 95 inland. The fog was reducing visibilities to a few hundred yards or less in some locations. The fog is expected to continue across the area past sunrise, and then burn off between 8 and 9 AM. Should dense fog become widespread, then a Dense Fog Advisory will be needed. Drivers should prepare to encounter rapid visibility reductions early this morning, especially as the morning rush hour commute approaches. Consider leaving early so that you can arrive safely at your destination at a safe driving speed. When driving in fog, slow down, use only your low beam headlights, and leave extra distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you.
